news-item.title: Basil Read Holdings increases on low volume
news-item.text:
Basil Read Holdings Limited (J:BSR), South Africa's 8th largest other construction company by market capitalisation, increased 2.0c (or 0.2%) to close at ZAR8.10, ending a two-day streak of losses. Compared with the FTSE/JSE: Africa Top 40 Index which rose 462.1 points (or 1.1%) in the day, this represented a relative price change of -0.9%. The volume was 0.001 times the average trading of 178,201 shares. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Basil Read Holdings, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051261770314194 Bullish SignalsUptrend- The stock's relative price strength percentile is rising at 47 for 6 months, 61 for 3 months and 84 for 1 month.- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 8.07 minus the 26-day EMA of 7.9 is positive 0.17 suggesting a bullish signal. Both EMA prices are rising, another bullish signal. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price/Sales of 0.2 [0.3]. We estimate Basil Read Holdings stock is trading at a current year Price/Sales of 0.2 and a forward year Price/Sales of 0.2. - Price to Book of 0.8 [1.4]. We estimate Basil Read Holdings stock is trading at a current year Price to Book of 0.6 and a forward year Price to Book of 0.5.Other Bullish Signals:- Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.2. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued and ranks in the top 8% of stock by value of Q Ratio.- Revenue growth rate has shown signs of recovery in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
Bearish Signals- The price decreased 1.0% in the last week. - The present value of ZAR1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in Basil Read Holdings is ZAR819, including a capital loss of ZAR325 and dividend reinvested of ZAR144. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price to EBITDA of 6.1 [4.6].Other Bearish Signals:- Total Liabilities/ EBITDA of 19.2 is more than or equal to 5, this compares unfavourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - Net profit margin has averaged 1.4% in the last 3 years. This suggests the company is less profitable with a low margin of safety.- The Enterprise Value/EBITDA multiple of 5.1 compares unfavourably with sector average of 3.2. Enterprise Value is estimated at MCap ZAR1.1 billion plus net debt of ZAR-201.5 million plus minority interest of ZAR24.8 million and EBITDA is estimated at ZAR175.6 million. NoteVolume: there were 98 shares worth ZAR794 (US$74) traded. Beta: the Beta of Basil Read Holdings stock is 0.3. A Beta lower than 1 suggests this is a low risk, low return stock with volatility less than that of the market. - Basil Read Holdings is at a discount of 32.5% to its 12-month high of ZAR12.0 on 03 Apr, 2013. It is also at a premium of 46.5% to the 12-month low of ZAR5.53 on 12 Aug, 2013.
